name: AVCaptureFileOutput
desc: The abstract superclass for capture outputs that can record captured data to a file.

items.name: var delegate: AVCaptureFileOutputDelegate?
items.desc: The delegate object for the capture file output.

items.name: var maxRecordedDuration: CMTime
items.desc: The longest duration allowed for the recording.

items.name: var maxRecordedFileSize: Int64
items.desc: The maximum size, in bytes, of the data that should be recorded by the receiver.

items.name: var minFreeDiskSpaceLimit: Int64
items.desc: The minimum amount of free space, in bytes, required for recording to continue on a given volume.

items.name: var outputFileURL: URL?
items.desc: The URL to which output is directed.

items.name: var recordedDuration: CMTime
items.desc: Indicates the duration of the media recorded to the current output file.

items.name: var recordedFileSize: Int64
items.desc: Indicates the size, in bytes, of the data recorded to the current output file.

items.name: var isRecording: Bool
items.desc: Indicates whether recording is in progress.

items.name: var isRecordingPaused: Bool
items.desc: Indicates whether recording to the current output file is paused.

items.name: func startRecording(to: URL, recordingDelegate: AVCaptureFileOutputRecordingDelegate)
items.desc: Starts recording media to the specified output URL.

items.name: func stopRecording()
items.desc: Tells the receiver to stop recording to the current file.

items.name: func pauseRecording()
items.desc: Pauses recording to the current output file.

items.name: func resumeRecording()
items.desc: Resumes recording to the current output file after it was previously paused using pauseRecording().
